alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Vance; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 7:23PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Vance, southern Warren and northern Franklin Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Louisburg, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Louisburg, Kittrell, Centerville, Afton, Arcola and Ingleside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Dont wait until you see the first lightning flash before heading to safety. Move indoors at the first sign of threatening skies or the first sound of thunder. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind. Make sure that lightning is well away from your location before resuming outdoor activity.
